result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, plus costs, disbursements and fees. To be paid from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
*Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No gang involvement.

Anger management classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.
*Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA smaple if not previously provided.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon Alvarado Jr

records.addlTxt:
Per Order dated September 27, 2022, Appeal No 2021AP2057-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for the State to file the respondent's brief in this matter is extended to October 13, 2022.

Per Order dated 06-01-2022, Appeal No 2021AP2057-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the hold previously imposed in this matter is lifted and this appeal may proceed.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the scope of this appeal does not include the circuit court's order denying reconsideration of the decision to deny Alvarado's postconviction motion.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Alvarado to file his appellant's brief and appendix is established as July 11, 2022, see WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2019-20), and further deadlines shall be determined pursuant to the rules of appellate procedure.
All exhibits that were returned from appeals staff returned to inventory BOX 641.
Clerk mailed copy of Decision and Order to Defendant  (Ramon Alvarado, Jr. - #342117, Waupun Correctional Institution, PO Box 351, Waupun WI 53963).
DECISION AND ORDER DENYING MOTION TO SUPPLEMENT THE RECORD; signed and filed.

Per Order dated April 7, 2022, Appeal No 2021AP2057-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for the circuit court to decide the appellant's postconviction motion is retroactively extended to March 14, 2022, and the appellant's November 30, 2021 notice of appeal from the denial of the postconviction motion and the judgment of conviction is considered timely pursuant to WIS. STAT. Rule 808.04(8).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Alvarado to file, with the clerk of the circuit court, a notice of appeal from the March 14, 2022 order denying his motion for reconsideration is extended to May 13, 2022. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that if Alvarado files a notice of appeal from the March 14, 2022 order denying his motion for reconsideration, the clerk of the circuit court shall, within five days, forward the order to the clerk of this court as a supplement to the record in this appeal.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the filing of the appellant's brief is stayed until further order of this court, pending a determination of whether the scope of this appeal will include the denial of the motion for reconsideration.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Feiss, Br. 46, for review. mag
Defendant's Motion to Correct the Record.  (Ramon Alvarado, Jr. - #342117, Waupun Correctional Institution, PO Box 351, Waupun WI 53963).

DECISION AND ORDER PARTIALLY DENYING MOTION FOR POSTCONVICTION RELIEF AND ORDER FOR RETROSPECTIVE LOMAX HEARING; signed and filed.

SO ORDERED.

(jury list).
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised the parties that the jury has reached a verdict.  At the hour of 10:10 a.m., the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts as follows:  Count 1 - Guilty; Count 2 - Guilty, both of were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled for the afternoon reporter.  Jurors have a question.  Received and filed:  juror question.  Reponse discussed on the record, written by the Court, and returned to the jury.  Deliberations continue.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.  Court advised the parties that the jury has another question and needs testimony read back.  Juror question received and filed. Defense counsel objected.  Court denied defense request and granted jurors' request.  Madam reporter from the morning portion of the trial on today's date was called to return to court.  Jury in box.  Testimony requested by the jurors' read back to them on the record.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.  Juror question received and read into the record, indicating that at this time they were hung.  Due to the lateness of the hour, the   Court ordered jurors released for the evening with instructions to return by 9:30 a.m.  Parties agreed.  Court in recess until November 13, 2014 at 9:45 a.m.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's in-court officer:  Detective Bell.  Trial resumes..  Jury in box.  Stipulation read to the jury and into the record.  State rests.  Sworn for defense:  Defendant, Ramon Alvarado, Jr.  Defense rests. Jury out of box.  Sworn for State on rebuttal:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Patrick Elm.  Exhibit #40 offered and received.  State rests on rebuttal.  No surrebuttal.  Court ordered testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments heard from the State and defense counsel.    Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:20 a.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Joann Karczewski and Thomas Antkowski who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's in-court officer:  Detective Matthew Bell.  Case recalled for the afternoon reporter.  Jury back in box.  Trial resumes. Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee Police Detective Matthew Bell; City of Milwaukee Police Detective Terrence Wright;  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Patrick Elm; City of Milwaukee Police Officer Diana Barchus.  State recalls Detective Matthew Bell, who was re-sworn.  Exhibits #9 - #13, #16, #17, #18,  #19,  #20, #22, #23, #24, #25, #26, #27, #28, #30, #31, #32 - #39 offered and received.  Exhibits #32 - #37 published to the jury.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  At the hour of 4:25 p.m., the Court excused the jurors for the evening with instructions to return by 8:30 a.m.  Jury out box.  Defense motion to dismiss  at close of State's case denied by the Court.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and his right not to testify.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's in-court officer:  Detective Matthew Bell.  Jury in box at 8:53 a.m. Trial proceeds.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Timothy Koceja.  Defendant objects, pro se, to statement proffered.  Jury out of box.  Court admonished defendant for both his outburst and threat to his attorney, and warned that further non-compliance would result in possible new charges and that the trial would proceed while he is in a cell.  Jury back in box.  Testimony of Detective Koceja continues.  Sworn for the State:  Mr. Jose L.; Ms. Pamela S.  Jury out of box.  Sidebar placed on record.  Jury back in box.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Laura Captain.  Exhibits #1 - #8, #14, and #21 offered and received.  Exhibits #1 - #8 were published to the jury.  At the hour of 12:00 p.m., the Court excused the jurors for the noon hour with instructions to return by 1:30 p.m.  Jury out of box.  Court in recess for the noon hour.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's in-court officer:  Detective Matthew Bell.  Case precalled; defense counsel advised that this case remains in trial posture.  Issue of motion hearing discussed on the record.  Defense witnesses do not appear; defendant withdraws motion hearing.  Court had colloquy with defendant and he found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a motion hearing.  Court passed case to 1:30 p.m.  

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  1:55 p.m.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the county of Milwaukee, Wisconsin, qualified to serve as jurors in the above-entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.   Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  At the hour of 4:50 p.m, the Court excused jurors for the evening with instructions to return by 8:30 a.m. on 11/11/14.  Jury out of box. Court in recess.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State stipulated to motion to suppress statement.   Defense motion addressing identification and illegal search then proceeds with defense counsel first establishing standing.    Court grants State's  motion for sequestration of  witnesses.  Sworn for defense:  Ms. Gloria P.  Court ordered proceedings halted and to be continued on the day of trial with an interpreter ordered for said witness.  This clerk contacted interpreter coordinator to request same; said request was confirmed.  Defense counsel requested that defendant's cell phone be released from police custody; State objected; Court denied defense request.  Defendant interrupted requesting new counsel and was warned by the Court that outbursts of this type will not be tolerated.  Court ordered case adjourned to the date of trial, 11/10/14 at 8:30 a.m., with motion hearing commencing promptly before trial.
Copies of the letter and bail motion filed by defendant sent to ADA Stingl and Attorney Earle.
/from defendant with three copies of "bail motion" filed.
/from defendant, pro se with attached Motion for Speedy Trial (already demanded by defense counsel on 8/19/14), received and filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before 11/17/14.

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court, defendant Ramon Alvarado not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel entered a speedy trial on behalf of his client and indicated he would proceed on the motions previously provided.  Court set the following motion schedule should defense counsel wish to add any additional motion(s):  movant to file by 9/04/14; response due by 9/19/14; reply due by 9/24/14.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court, defendant Ramon Alvarado not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for Dennis Stingl for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has obtained new counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 08-19-2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from defendant to the court, filed.
/from defendant, filed.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Scott David Obernberger.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court vacated the 8/25/14 jury trial date.

Attorney Scott D Obernberger in court, defendant Ramon Alvarado not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion date re-set; defense counsel indicated it was not dispositive and requested a trial date.  Case is rescheduled for motion hearing and final pretrial before Branch 20.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one week of the final pretrial date.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Court grants attorney request that the judge who hears the motion, be the same judge who presides over the jury trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case in court for final pre-trial.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants the defense's motion for an adjournment of the speedy Jury Trial.  Court vacates jury trial on 06/02/2014. Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado not in court, defendant in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  
Attorney Obernberger, who was appointed to this case by Judge Watts, contacted the court and the Assistant District Attorney assigned to this case, that he would be out of town and unavailable to appear on the adjourned Preliminary Hearing date that was previously scheduled for February 26, 2014.   Due to these circumstances this case will be adjourned.  Preliminary hearing date of February 26, 2014 is VACATED.  Preliminary hearing rescheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Obernberger was not available for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  Court appoints Attorney Scott Obernberger to represent the defendant; Attorney Obernberger to be paid at the standard rate of $60.00 per hour.  The court ordered no repayment by the defendant. Case remains on the calendar for Preliminary Haring on 2/11/2014.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ramon Alvarado in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ramon Alvarado in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Upon request of the defendant the complaint is read aloud in court by the district attorney.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is refusing public defender representation. and wishes to proceed pro-se at this time.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
